item.title: COVID-19: Wizara ya Afya yathibitisha maambukizi mengine 137, vifo 2
item.description: - Mgonjwa mwenye umri wa chini zaidi ni mtoto wa miaka miwili naye mkongwe ana miaka 98 - Kufikia sasa taifa limepima jumla ya sampuli 1,134,494 tangu kisa cha kwanza cha coronavirus kilipotua nchini mwezi Machi. - Wagonjwa 694 wamelazwa katika vituo mbali mbali vya afya na 1,670 nao wanapokea huduma za matibabu wakiwa manyumbani mwao Kenya imeandikisha maabukizi mengine 137 ya COVID-19 katika saa 24 zilizopita na kufikisha idadi ya wagonjwa nchini hadi 99,444.

Trivia His reality fame translated to social media fame. He has earned more than 750,000 Instagram followers and 8,000 Twitter followers. Family Life He has a sister. He began a relationship with Cara de la Hoyde and they had a son named Freddie together in 2017.

item.title: 'Tales of the Jedi' Introduces a New Villain in the 'Star Wars' Universe
item.description: All six episodes of 'Tales of the Jedi' are now streaming on Disney Plus, and fans are wondering if the Sixth Brother will make an appearance. Source: Disney PlusSpoiler alert: This article contains spoilers for Ahsoka by E. K. Johnston. Alas, well-known filmmaker Dave Filoni continues to prove that animation is the superior form of Star Wars thanks to his latest project, Tales of the Jedi. On Oct. 26, all six episodes debuted on Disney Plus, and we have to say — it's must-see TV.

item.title: Anna Zak - Age, Family, Bio
Attahiru Jega, Okebukola Gets New Federal Appointment
item.description: Ex-INEC Chairman, Prof Attahiru Jega, (Photo Credit: myjoyonline.com) A former chairman of the Independent National Electoral Commission, (INEC), Prof Attahiru Jega, alongside the past executive secretary of the National Universities Commission, Prof Peter Okebukola, and others have been tasked by the federal government to review Nigeria’s university system. Peter Okebukola, a former executive secretary of the NUC, was also included in a committee set up by the government. Abubakar Rasheed, executive secretary, National Universities Commission (NUC), made this known on Monday after he appeared before the senate committee on tertiary institutions and TETFUND.

item.title: Is MeWe a Good Alternative to Facebook for People Who Want More Privacy?
item.description: People Are Tired of Facebook's Privacy Violations — This New Platform Might Be the SolutionBy Jamie LernerUpdated Nov. 16 2020, 10:17 p.m. ET Source: Getty ImagesIn the age of Facebook, it seems like everyone knows what everyone else is doing and where everyone is at all times. And not only does Bobby from middle school know our pets’ names, but corporations seem to have some sort of insight into our web activity that helps them advertise to us all over Facebook.

item.title: Diana Marua discloses she was a married man's mpango wa kando for years
item.description: - According to Marua, in her early 20s, she was never broke as she always dated men for money - The mother of two recounted that the men would pay her rent, buy her clothes, shopping and even take her out - She recounted dating a man who was married and who openly told her he would never leave his wife for her but would give her all the expensive things in life

item.title: Is The Onion Banned from Twitter? It's Just Some Pretty Clever Satire
item.description: The Onion Isn't Really Banned from Twitter, but It's Latest Campaign Is AmusingBy Joseph AllenPublished April 22 2022, 10:46 a.m. ET Source: TwitterIn a recent series of tweets and stories posted to their website, the satirical news site The Onion is claiming that they have been permanently banned from Twitter. Naturally, some wondered whether this ban was actually real, and were obviously skeptical given that The Onion specializes in satirical news.

item.title: Top Nigerian Newspaper Headlines For Today, Sunday, 24th July, 2022
item.description: Good morning Nigeria, welcome to Naija News roundup of top newspaper headlines in Nigeria for today Sunday, 24th July 2022. The Media Adviser to Atiku Abubakar, Presidential candidate of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), Paul Ibe has tackled the Bola Tinubu Campaign Organisation over some points it raised. Naija News had earlier reported that the Tinubu Campaign Organisation had stated that it was extremely shocked by the many lies and ignorance displayed by the PDP’s presidential candidate during an interview with Arise TV.

item.title: 'Wednesday' Latest News and Updates
item.description: The Netflix original series Wednesday follows Wednesday Addams down a dangerous road as she works to uncover a mystery unfolding at Nevermore Academy (a school for outcasts like herself). Using her sometimes-reliable psychic powers, she must thwart a monster's killing spree and uncover the truth beneath a decades-old scandal that involved her parents, Morticia and Gomez Addams. From creators Miles Millar and Alfred Gough and director Tim Burton, the series boasts the Edward Scissorhands director's penchant for quirky darkness.

item.title: Kap G - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Born George Ramirez and known to his fans as Kap G, this rapper released a mixtape titled Like A Mexican (2014), as well as "La Policia," "Tatted Like Amigos," and several other singles. Before Fame After his debut mixtape earned him critical acclaim, he began recording his first EP with the help of Pharrell Williams. Trivia In addition to contributing to the film's soundtrack, Kap G appeared briefly in the 2015 feature Dope.

item.title: Middle Belt Forum Raises Alarm Over Alleged Plot By The Presidency To 'Forcefully Suspend Ortom As G
item.description: The Middle Belt Forum, MBF, has described the allegations leveled by the Presidency against Governor Samuel Ortom over his recent controversial interview on Channels TV as unfounded and part of efforts to suspend him from office. Presidential spokesman, Garba Shehu had accused Ortom of instigating genocidal attacks against the Fulani ethnic group in a 10-paragraph response to the issues concerning the federal government’s handling of the nation’s insecurity which were raised by the governor in his interview.

item.title: Randy Johnson - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: 10-time MLB All-Star and 5-time Cy Young Award winner known as "The Big Unit," who first made a name for himself with the Seattle Mariners. He won the World Series MVP award in 2001, after leading the Arizona Diamondbacks to an unlikely 7-game victory over the New York Yankees. In 2015, he was inducted into the Baseball Hall of Fame.  Before Fame He was a sports star in two different sports, basketball and football at USC.

item.title: 120+ deep love messages for him that will make him feel special
item.description: Numerous people erroneously believe that men are not verbal beings, and neither should they express their emotions. This is far from the truth because they, too, need love and affection. Crafting and sending deep love messages for him is one of the ways of letting him know how much you love and appreciate him. Did you know deep love messages for him can help your relationship blossom? Assuring your man he is still your knight in shining armour will make him feel good about himself.

item.title: Tuskys Supermarket yaanza kutumia mashine zilizo na uwezo mkubwa kukabiliana na wizi
item.description: -Teknolojia hiyo mpya itasaidia duka hilo la reja reja katika kuweka na kutunza fedha -Tuskys inasemekana kupoteza takriban KSh 100 milioni kupitia kwa wizi wa ndani kila mwezi -Wafanyikazi kadhaa wamefutwa kazi awali au kushtakiwa kwa kuiba pesa Duka la rejareja la Tuskys limemaliza kuweka mashine za kuweka pesa katika matawi yake yote nchini ili kukabiliana na wizi wa wafanyikazi. Habari Nyingine: Mwanamume amnunulia Samantha wake gari la KSh 2 milioni Kwa kushirikiana na Diamond Trust Bank (DTB), Tuskys imekuwa ikiweka mashine hizo(iCDM) katika matawi yake yote.

item.title: 'Stop Blaming Buhari For Your Reckless Policies'
item.description: Nigeria’s former Minister of Youths and Sports, Solomon Dalung, has berated President Bola Ahmed Tinubu-led government’s consistent practice of attributing Nigeria’s economic challenges to ex-President Muhammad Buhari. In a series of posts via his X account on Monday, Dalung argued that the Tinubu administration’s reckless policies caused the country’s current economic woes. According to him, if Tinubu’s administration directed the same level of resources and effort of blame game towards addressing security and economic issues as they did during elections and tribunals, significant improvements could be made.

item.title: Ali Wong Reveals All of the Lines That Keanu Reeves Improvised in 'Always Be My Maybe'
item.description: Keanu Reeves Improvised These Hilarious Lines in 'Always Be My Maybe' According to Ali WongBy Mustafa GatollariUpdated June 26 2019, 2:46 p.m. ET Always be my Maybe is getting rave reviews, but there's a clear standout scene in the film for people and it involves everyone's favorite Hollywood blockbuster actor and star of John Wick: Mr. Keanu Reeves. There's been a lot of obsessing over Keanu these past few years and a lot of it has to do with the success of his silly-idea-made-amazing action film franchise.

item.title: How to bake cake: A simple step by step tutorial for beginners
item.description: Do you want to learn how to bake cake? Today, we are going to learn how to prepare a simple cake. The steps are easy and straightforward and you will love the outcome. The recipe we will use to teach you how to make a cake from scratch is quite simple. It is the perfect recipe for those people who do not like spending too much time in the kitchen as well as those who are new in the “baking-industry”.

item.title: Top 15 black female gospel singers of all time
item.description: Gospel music industry is growing exponentially with new artists making entry every year. However, while the number of male artists is growing, black female gospel singers are less predominant in the top-performing charts. The golden opportunity has been afforded to female artists through the growth of digital platforms and media. Gospel, just like other genres of music, is adapting and growing depending on demand and media. One of the biggest threats lies in the disparity of gender distribution which is still gaping.

item.title: Bob Collymore ateuliwa kama mwanachama wa bodi ya taasisi ya saratani nchini

Wengine ambao wameteuliwa ni pamoja na David Mukami, Evangeline Njiru na Mercy Oburu ambaye amekuwa akihudumu kama meneja wa taarifa za mitandaoni katika shirika la Royal Media Services. Habari Nyingine: Gavana wa Elgeyo - Marakwet ataka makundi ya Tanga Tanga, Kieleweka yavunjwe Kwenye taarifa iliyochapishwa katika gazeti la serikali mnamo Jumatano, Mei 8, Waziri wa afya Sicily Kariuki alidokeza kuwa walioteuliwa katika wadhifa huo watahudumu kama wanachama wa bodi ya taasisi hiyo kwa miaka mitatu.

item.title: 2023 Election: It Is Preposterous And Unconscionable
item.description: The Bola Ahmed Tinubu-led administration has rejected the European Union’s conclusions on the 2023 general elections. Naija News recalls that the European Union Election Observation Mission (EU EOM) had criticized the handling of Nigeria’s 2023 general elections. It said the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) failed to deliver on its promise of a transparent and inclusive democratic process. The EU EOM pointed to gaps in law and electoral administration that negatively affected the quality and inclusiveness of the elections and undermined trust in the INEC.

item.title: Andrew Brady - Age, Family, Bio
Instagram Is Removing Likes and Influencers Are Freaking Out
item.description: Instagram Is Removing Likes, and Influencers Are Not Happy About ItBy Rebecca MacateeUpdated July 18 2019, 3:41 p.m. ET Source: Getty ImagsInstagram is removing likes and hiding video views for some people in different countries around the world. It's part of a test to find out if hiding these popularity metrics will actually give users a better social media experience. For most people, this change wouldn't be a big deal, but for influencers, it's a big problem.

item.title: Pounds To Naira Exchange Rate/Black Market Rate Today 17 March 2022
item.description: This is the news about the Pounds to Naira rate at the official and black market exchange rate Today March 17 2022. Read Naija News update on the official pounds rates as well as Black Market rates, Bureau De Change (BDC) rates, and CBN rates. How Much is Pounds To Naira Exchange Rate Today Official Rate? The official rate today, Thursday, 17th March, 2022, for £1 pound to naira = ₦544.6056/£1. According to the data from the CBN, exchange rate between the naira and the British pounds opened at ₦544.

item.title: Gunshots As Supporters Of Gov Oyetola And Aregbesola Clash At APC Secretariat
item.description: There were gunshots recorded on Saturday at the Osun secretariat of the All Progressives Congress(APC) following a clash between supporters of some party stalwarts. Particularly, Naija News gathered there was a clash between supporters of Governor Adegboyega Oyetola and Minister for Interior, Rauf Aregbesola. The clash occurred around 4.15pm during the sitting of the APC Ward Congress Appeal Committee in Osogbo, the State capital. However, after the fight broke out between the supporters at the venue of the exercise, security operatives on ground had to step in and rescue members of the committee.

item.title: How Many Children Does Lance Armstrong Have? Meet the Cyclist's Blended Family
item.description: How many children does Lance Armstrong have? The former American cyclist has a blended family. Here's what fans should know. Source: Getty ImagesIt’s not breaking news that Lance Armstrong has had quite a bumpy road with his pro-cycling career. In fact, many fans were disappointed to see Lance be stripped of all seven of his Tour de France titles due to doping allegations. Despite Lance’s career and legal troubles, the 50-year-old has always been passionate about family.

item.description: Tems wrote the original song that we hear in Drake and Future's "WAIT FOR U." Here's what the American Music Awards nominee said about the track. Every few years, an artist comes around and changes the game. After the year that she’s had, it’s safe to say that Tems is that girl. Born Temilade Openiyi, the singer hails from Lagos, Nigeria, and rose to fame after the release of her collaborative single “Essence,” with WizKid and Justin Bieber in 2021.

item.title: Nigeria Representative Emmanuel Ikubese Comes 2nd At Mr World Contest
item.description: While everyone is looking forward to the Super Eagles' brilliant performance during their first World Cup game against Iran, another Nigerian made the country proud at Mr World contest. Actor and model Emmanuel Ikubese emerged second and was also voted the most stylish contestant in the competition held yesterday at the Riviera International Conference Centre, Torbay, UK. Meanwhile the first prize went to the golden-haired Nicklas Pedersen from Denmark (pictured below).

item.title: Nkechi Blessing Reacts To Falegan's Claim Of Not Changing Her Underwear In 3 Days, Reveals Personal
item.description: Popular Nollywood actress Nkechi Blessing has reacted to ex-lover, Opeyemi Falegan accusation of not changing her undies in 3 days. Recall that Naija News earlier reported that Falegan had apologized to the Nollywood actress during a live session with Daddy Freeze. Many people thought he wanted Nkechi back, hence his apology. However, in a video sent to Uche Maduagwu, Falegan stated that was not the case and accused the actress of having poor hygiene.

item.title: "Where My Black People at?" Man Wants to Know Why Natural Hair Products Are so Expensive
item.description: One man is fed up with the prices of natural hair products, and folks online agree that some of the essentials can truly break the bank. Source: TikTok/@arrington171It’s beautiful to see so many Black people embrace their natural textures and allow the beauty of their hair to shine. Celebrities like Issa Rae, Yara Shahidi, Sanaa Lathan, and more are beloved for donning their natural tresses. That said, since natural hair requires the very best products and formulations to keep your texture in tip-top shape, various brands from Mielle Organics to Tracee Ellis Ross’s Pattern Beauty come in major clutch to get the job done.

item.title: INEC Officially Declares Winner Of Bayelsa Governorship Election
item.description: The Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) has officially announced the incumbent Governor of Bayelsa State and governorship candidate of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), Douye Diri, as the winner of the State governorship election held last Saturday. Naija News reports that the Returning Officer, Prof Faruq Kuta, who is also the Vice Chancellor of the Federal University Of Technology, Minna, announced Diri winner of the poll at the collation centre of the election on Monday.

item.title: Is Q'orianka Kilcher Back for 'Yellowstone' Season 5? Here's What We Know
item.description: Actress Q'orianka Kilcher plays lawyer Angela Blue Thunder on 'Yellowstone,' but fans weren't sure if she would return for Season 5. Here's what you need to know. Source: Getty ImagesFans were curious when actress Q'orianka Kilcher, who plays lawyer Angela Blue Thunder on Yellowstone, didn't return for Season 4. Her character was introduced during Season 3 as a friend of Thomas Rainwater (Gil Birmingham), who asks her to help the people of the Broken Rock Indian Reservation.

Here's What to KnowBy Stephanie HarperDec. 2 2021, Published 1:32 p.m. ET Source: Instagram/@SavannahChrisleyThere are plenty of noteworthy family members to pay attention to on Chrisley Knows Best, but Savannah Chrisley has definitely garnered a lot of public interest. With over 2.3 million followers on Instagram, it’s obvious people are curious to know more about her and what’s happening in her personal life.

item.title: Buhari Speaks On FOREX, Promises To Address Importation And Supply Issues
item.description: President Muhammadu Buhari has promised that his administration will address without hesitation issues relating to foreign exchange and importation of raw materials and machines that are not available locally. Naija News understands that the number one citizen of Nigeria on Wednesday reiterated his government’s commitment towards growing manufacturing activities in the country when he played host to the leadership of the Manufacturers Association of Nigeria (MAN) at the Presidential Villa, Abuja.

item.title: Elena Kampouris - Age, Family, Bio

Before Fame Her first role was as a guest-star on Gossip Girl in 2012. Her first film was the 2013 TV movie Jinxed. Trivia She landed the part of Maya Drucker in the 2015 television movie Odyssey. Throughout her acting career, she has earned over a dozen credits.

item.title: Nigerian Army Reportedly Appoints New Spokesperson
item.description: A new Director of Army Public Relations in the person of Onyema Nwachukwu has been appointed by the Chief of Army Staff, Farouk Yahaya. According to insider sources, Nwachukwu will take over from Mohammed Yerima, who was appointed into the position in February 2021. Until his appointment, Mr Nwachukwu was the Acting Director of Defence Information, at the Defence Headquarters. He was the Deputy Director Public Relations, Headquarters Theatre Command Operation HADIN KAI formerly known as Operation LAFIYA DOLE.

item.title: Brooke Adee - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Music performing artist popular on social media who posts cover songs to her YouTube channel cupiecakegirl123. She competed on season eight of The Voice. Before Fame Growing up, she sang and acted in school plays and other venues. Trivia The musical Annie served as a major inspiration to her passion for music. Family Life She is the older sister of Ashley, Carissa, and Austin. She was born in Austin, Texas and moved to Atlanta when she was 2 years old.

item.title: Inside Lindsay and Danielle's Feud on 'Summer House' Season 7 (EXCLUSIVE)
item.description: In an exclusive interview with 'Distractify,' 'Summer House' star Sam Feher opened up about Lindsay and Danielle's ongoing Season 7 feud. Friends no more... Tensions have flared as former Summer House besties, Lindsay Hubbard and Danielle Olivera, have not been seeing eye-to-eye on Season 7 of the hit Bravo series. While the fallout of their friendship has been teased throughout the reality series, fans finally get a first look at what really went down between Lindsay and Danielle.

item.title: Kayla Patterson - Age, Family, Bio
Mass sack hits 3 Nigerian banks
item.description: - Skye Bank Plc sends 175 of its employees into the labour market - Ecobanks sacks more than 1040 employees - Diamond Bank fires 200 of its workers The low oil prices, uncertainty in foreign exchange and the dwindling economy in the country have taken its toll on the banking sector. This follows reports that banks are beginning to cut down the number of their employees. According to a report on The Punch, some banks rated well high by the Central Bank of Nigeria, have been hit by the current economy crisis, which has resulted in the reduction of their work force.

item.title: 'Arrest Anyone Crossing The Highway'
item.description: The Lagos State Government has ordered officials of the state Environmental Safety Corps, popularly known as Kick Against Indiscipline (KAI), alongside other agencies, to arrest anyone crossing the highway. Naija News reports that the state Commissioner for the Environment and Water Resources, Tokunbo Wahab, disclosed this via his X handle on Sunday. He described crossing major highways in the state by pedestrians as an offence, adding that any defaulter caught will be arrested and prosecuted.

item.title: 'Storage Wars' Cast, Spinoffs, and Where Is Barry?
item.description: A&E's Storage Wars premiered in 2010 and followed professional buyers in California as they attempted to outbid each other at abandoned storage unit auctions, led by auctioneers Dan and Laura Dotson.  While most of the storage units featured on the show were not worth the trouble, there were a few finds with big profits. The series proved to wildly popular and led to a handful of spinoffs on the network including Storage Wars: Texas, Storage Wars: Miami, Storage Wars: New York, and Brandi & Jarrod: Married to the Job.

item.description: American actress best known for her role as Eve in the film Once Upon a Time in America. She has also acted on TV in series such as Crime Story and Hunter. Family Life She grew up in Pasadena, California. She was married to Michael Ira Small from 1983 until 2004.

Recall that on the said date, an episode of The Overlap featured Dele Alli in which he revealed his difficult childhood to former England international Gary Neville. In the interview, Alli claimed that he was sexually molested by his mother’s friend at age six, taken to Africa (Nigeria) at age seven to be disciplined, and got involved in drug trafficking at age eight.

item.title: EFCC Belongs To All Nigerians And Is Not For Anybody
item.description: The Chairman of the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission (EFCC), Abdulrasheed Bawa has declared that the anti-graft agency can’t fight corruption alone. This is as he declared that EFCC belongs to all Nigerians and all stakeholders must join hands with the commission to fight corruption in the country. Bawa made the submission on Monday when he hosted members of a civil society organization, Civil Society Coalition for Transparency and Good Governance, at the Commission’s headquarters, Abuja.

item.title: APC Governors Visit Ex-President Jonathan
item.description: Some governors elected on the platform of the All Progressives Congress (APC) have met with former President Goodluck Jonathan. Naija News reports that the governors met with Jonathan at his Abuja residence. It was gathered that the APC governors were at the former president’s residence to felicitate with him on his 63rd birthday anniversary. Those who visited the former president include: Yobe State Governor, Mai Mala Buni; Ebonyi State Governor, David Umahi, Kebbi State Governor, Atiku Bagudu and Jigawa State Governor, Abubakar Badaru.

item.title: Todd Boehly Takeover Chelsea From Roman Abramovich
item.description: English Premier League club, Chelsea have announced the club’s new ownership group. In an official statement sighted by Naija News on the club’s website on Saturday morning, Todd Boehly would be leading a group of four in the acquisition of the English club. The club’s new owner led by Boehly included, Clearlake Capital, Mark Walter and Hansjoerg Wyss. As confirmed in the official document, a payment of £3.5billion has been made as takeover to replacing Roman Abramovich.

item.title: Details Of PDP BoT Meeting With Wike Emerge
item.description: The details of the meeting between the Board of Trustees (BoT) of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) and the Rivers State Governor, Nyesom Wike have emerged. Naija News had earlier reported that members of the BoT met with Wike at the Government House in Port Harcourt, the state capital on Tuesday. Those in attendance include the acting Chairman of the PDP BoT, former Governor of Kogi State, Ibrahim Idris, former Enugu Governor, Okwesilieze Nwodo, former Deputy National Chairman of PDP, Shuaib Oyedokun; a Senior Advocate of Nigeria, Kabiru Turaki, Dr Esther Uduehi and Hajia Zainab Maina.

item.title: Buhari Swears In Olukayode Ariwoola As Acting CJN
item.description: President Muhammadu Buhari has sworn in Justice Olukayode Ariwoola as the acting Chief Justice of Nigeria, (CJN). This follows the resignation of former CJN, Justice Ibrahim Tanko Muhammad earlier today over suspected ill health issues. Ariwoola was sworn in on Monday at the Council Chambers in Abuja. He arrived in the company of fellow Justices of the Supreme Court at about 2.45pm in a white tinted coaster bus and headed straight for the Council Chambers.

item.title: Is 'Somebody I Used to Know' Based on a True Story?
item.description: Alison Brie and Dave Franco wrote the Amazon Prime movie 'Somebody I Used to Know.' Was this rom-com inspired by real life events? Actor Alison Brie, best known for her roles in Community and Mad Men, stars in a new rom-com for Prime Video. Dubbed Somebody I Used to Know, Alison not only stars in the film but also co-wrote the script alongside her directing husband, Dave Franco. The movie centers around her character — coincidentally named Ally — who travels back to her hometown and bumps into her ex, Sean (Jay Ellis).

item.title: James Ransone III - Age, Family, Bio

Before Fame When he was 27, he was a failed musician with a heroin addiction and a $30,000 debt. He moved to Namibia for 8 months, and returned to play Person in Generation Kill. Trivia He starred as U.S. Marine Corporal Josh Ray Person in Generation Kill.

item.title: Malami Denies Filing Any Suit Against Atikus Citizenship
item.description: The Minister of Justice and Attorney-General of the Federation, Abubakar Malami, on Wednesday disclosed that the suit filed against the citizenship of former Vice-Presdient Atiku Abubakar was in 2019. The Minister further stated that the suit was filed by a civil society organisation, the Incorporated Trustees of Egalitarian Mission for Africa. Malami in a statement released through his spokesman, Umar Gwandu, titled, ‘I didn’t file suit against Atiku’s Citizenship – Malami’

item.title: Aruna Quadri Explains Why He Won't Participate In WTT Contender In Lagos
item.description: Legendary Nigerian table tennis player, Aruna Quadri has explained why he won’t be taking part in the 2023 World Table Tennis Contender in Lagos. Aruna Quadri said in a video he shared on his Instagram account, @quadriaruna on Tuesday that he won’t be able to participate in the tournament because of club obligations. The last time Aruna was in action was during the World Table Tennis Championship, which just ended in Durban, South Africa earlier this year.

item.title: Guinea Junta Sacks Electricity Chief Over Power Outages
item.description: Guinea has announced the removal of the head of its national electricity company due to ongoing power outages that led to violent demonstrations in the country under military rule. Naija News understands that Laye Sekou Camara, along with his two deputies, Fode Soumah and Abdoulaye Kone, were relieved of their duties through a decree signed by junta chief General, Mamady Doumbouya. Furthermore, the managing director and deputy of Guinea’s national oil company were also dismissed through a separate decree.

item.title: Sunday Igboho Not Responsible For Nigeria's Problems
item.description: The apex Igbo socio-cultural organization, Ohanaeze Ndigbo has told the federal government to stop chasing shadows in arresting Sunday Igboho but focus on solving the challenges facing the country. The group in a statement on Tuesday by its spokesperson, Alex Ogbonnia said if the real challenges facing Nigeria are not tackled by the government, more people in the mold of Sunday Igboho and Nnamdi Kanu will continue to emerge no matter the arrest and intimidation by security forces.

item.title: CS Matiang'i orders arrest of contractor for failing to complete 4km road in 4 years, warns others
item.description: - Interior CS Fred Matiang'i issued a warning to contractors who like playing games with public resources - He said some were delaying in delivering their projects even after being given resources to complete them - The CS said a contractor in Nyandarua county had delayed completing a four-kilometre road four years down the line - Matiang'i instructed police to arrest and charge him for misusing public resources Interior Cabinet Secretary Fred Matiang'i has ordered for the immediate arrest of a contractor who failed to complete a four and a half kilometre road for over four years after he was awarded the tender.

item.title: Kwankwaso Shortlists Four Names For Running Mate
item.description: The New Nigeria Peoples Party (NNPP) presidential candidate, Senator Rabiu Musa Kwankwaso has shortlisted four individuals to pick a running mate from. Naija News gathered that those considered for running mate, including a serving governor, were screened on Wednesday. A source close to Kwankwaso told The PUNCH that apart from the governor those screened are Kingsley Moghalu, Madam Charity from Bayelsa State, and Bishop Isaac Idahosa from Edo State. Asked if Idahosa had been picked as Kwankwaso’s running mate, the source said, “He is part of those considered.

item.title: Over 2.3M Nigerians Register For COVID-19 Vaccination In 24 Hours
item.description: The National Health Care Development Agency (NPHCDA) has disclosed that more than 2.3 million Nigerians have already registered for COVID-19 vaccination in 24 hours. The NPHCDA boss, Dr Faisal Shuaibu made the disclosure on Wednesday during a virtual interview. It will be recalled that the first batch of COVID-19 vaccines arrived in Nigeria on Tuesday, 2nd March, and the federal government launched a portal for Nigerians to register to be vaccinated.

item.title: Court Orders INEC To Take Fresh Action On Edo PDP Faction
item.description: A Federal High Court sitting in Benin has ordered the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) to recognize and publish the names of candidates produced by the Governor Godwin Obaseki faction of the Edo Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) as standard-bearers of the party in the forthcoming 2023 elections. In a judgement delivered on Tuesday, September 27, 2022 by Hon. Justice S.M Shuaibu, the Court granted all the reliefs sought by the plaintiffs.

item.title: Exam Script Of COVID-19 Candidates Will Be Kept In Special Bank WAEC
item.description: Mr Patrick Areghan, the head of West African Examination Council, WAEC, had given updates on candidates infected with Coronavirus. The WAEC head called on students who tested positive for Coronavirus not to panic, saying the virus is not a death sentence. Areghan said this on Wednesday during a monitoring visit to Federal Government Boys College, Apo, Abuja adding that no student infected with COVID-19 would miss the examinations. He further stated that the council would thereafter proceed to the isolation centre and collect the script which would be put in a special bank designated for the purpose.

item.title: Roberto Clemente - Trivia, Family, Bio
item.description: Hall of Fame MLB outfielder who played for the Pittsburgh Pirates from 1955 to 1972. He was named National League MVP in 1966 and was a 2-time World Series Champion, winning World Series MVP honors in 1971. He died tragically in a 1972 plane crash while flying to Nicaragua to tend to earthquake victims. Before Fame He would deliver milk cans in order to help make ends meet while growing up. Trivia He won 12 Gold Gloves and was named to 15 All-Star teams over the course of his career.

item.title: 2023: Why We Bought APC Presidential Forms For Jonathan
item.description: A Fulani group, Nomadic Pastoralists and the Almajiri Communities has been identified as the group that picked up the nomination and expression of interest forms for former President Goodluck Jonathan. Naija News had reported that a Northern group had visited the International Conference Center (ICC) on Monday to obtain the APC presidential forms for the former president. Speaking with newsmen on Monday, the leader of the group, Ibrahim Abdullahi, said they decided to obtain the forms for Jonathan to enable him to return to power and complete the good work he had started.

item.title: PDP Suspends Ayu With Immediate Effect
item.description: The National Chairman of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), Iyorchia Ayu, has been suspended by the Executive Committee of the party in Igyorov Ward in Gboko Local Government Area of Benue State, with immediate effect. The secretary of the committee, Banger Dooyum, said Ayu was suspended for anti-party activities after passing a vote of no confidence on him. Dooyum stressed that Ayu’s anti-party activities alongside his allies contributed to the loss of the party in his ward and local government in the governorship election.

item.description: Operatives of the Nigeria Police Force have arrested a criminal syndicate responsible for recent economic sabotage and vandalism of rail tracks in the North-West and North-Central parts of the country. The arrest of the suspects follows deliberate efforts by the Force to contain and clamp down on perpetrators of recent incidents of rail tracks vandalism, carting away of critical locomotive equipment and other related economic crimes in some parts of the country.

item.title: Court Orders INEC To Delete Andy Uba From Records, Says APC Didn't Hold Valid Anambra Governorship P
item.description: The federal high court sitting in Abuja, the nation’s capital city has ruled that Senator Andy Uba is not a valid candidate of the All Progressives Congress (APC) for the 2021 Anambra governorship election held on November 6. The court in a ruling on Monday by the presiding judge, Justice Inyang Ekwo said the APC didn’t conduct a valid primary election. Ekwo further instructed the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) to delete all records about Uba’s participation in the Anambra governorship polls from its records.

item.title: Killings In Plateau Caused By Land Grabbers, Illegal Miners
item.description: A former member of the Plateau State House of Representatives representing Jos South/Jos east, Dachung Musa Bagos, has claimed that the killings in Plateau State are prompted by land grabbers who use these communities for illegal mining and agricultural purposes. He insisted that there is no issue of ethnic, religious, or farmer/herder clash in the state. Bago asserted that false narratives have for many years, been put on the table to explain the killings in the state.

item.title: Tinubu Approves Establishment Of Presidential Committee On Tax Reforms
item.description: President Bola Tinubu has approved the establishment of a Presidential Committee on Fiscal Policy and Tax Reforms. The Special Adviser to the President on Special Duties, Communications and Strategy, Dele Alake, made this known in a statement on Friday in Abuja. According to the statement, the establishment of the  committee is in consonance with his promise to remove all barriers impeding business growth in the country. The statement noted that the committee will be chaired by Fiscal Policy Partner and Africa Tax Leader at PriceWaterhouseCoopers (PwC), Taiwo Oyedele.

item.description: Five Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) Governors on Sunday met in Enugu State over the 2023 presidential election. According to a report, the Governors held the closed-door meeting to deliberate on the presidential ambition of the Labour Party, flagbearer, Peter Obi. The Governors in the meeting include Nyesom Wike (Rivers State), Samuel Ortom (Benue State), Seyi Makinde (Oyo State), Okezie Ikpeazu (Abia State) and Ifeanyi Ugwuanyi (Enugu State). A source that spoke with Daily Post on the meeting said the PDP Governors are aiming at supporting Obi because they are not pleased with the presidential candidate of PDP, Atiku Abubakar.

item.title: 'Don't Contest 2027 Presidential Election' PDP Group Urges Atiku
item.description: The Concerned PDP League (CPDPL), a pressure group within the Peoples Democratic Party, has urged the party’s presidential candidate in the 2023 election, Atiku Abubakar, to refrain from running again in 2027. This counsel was communicated in a communiqué issued on Sunday in Abuja, signed by Tasiu Muhammed, the National Secretary, and Gbenga Adedamola, the acting National Director of Publicity and Strategic Communication. The CPDPL additionally appealed to Gov. Bala Mohammed, the chairman of the PDP Governors Forum and the incumbent governor of Bauchi State, advising him against harbouring any aspirations for the presidential office until 2031.

item.title: Burna Boy Replies Ex Girlfriend, Stefflon Don Over 'Mummy Boy' Statement
item.description: Nigerian singer, Damini Ogulu better Burna Boy, has replied British ex-lover and singer Stefflon Don after she threw a shade at ‘guys who claim to be men but are in fact, just a mama’s boy’. Trouble had earlier started when Stefflon Don via her Tiktok handle on Thursday decided to shade guys who claim to be men but are nothing but mummy’s boys. The video garnered a lot of mixed reactions from fans who had thought the British-Jamaican singer was referring to her ex lover, Burna Boy, who undoubtedly have a very close relationship with his mother, Bose Ogulu.

item.title: Court Bans FG From Deducting $418m From State Govts' Bank Accounts
item.description: The Federal Government has been issued a restraining order from accessing bank accounts of all state governments to withdraw the sum of $418million. Naija News reports that the alleged move by the Federal Government was halted in a ruling by Justice Inyang Ekwo of the Federal High Court, Abuja, on Friday, November 5. The court order was coming following an ex parte application argued by counsel to the 36 states, Jibrin Otukepa and Ahmed Raji, both Senior Advocates of Nigeria.

item.title: MTN Gives Reason For Network Outage, Reveals Plan
item.description: MTN Nigeria has provided an explanation for the service disruption experienced by its subscribers on Wednesday, attributing the issue to multiple fibre cuts. The telecommunications giant, which is one of the leading service providers in the country, acknowledged the impact of the outage on its voice and data services through a communication on its X page. The service interruption had left several users expressing their frustrations over the unexpected network disruption, impacting both personal and business communications across the country.

item.title: Ooni Of Ife Reveals Promise Alaafin Made To Him
item.description: The Ooni of Ife, Oba Adeyeye Enitan Ogunwusi has commended the late Alaafin of Oyo, Lamidi Adeyemi III for modernizing Oyo, while keeping the cultural sacredness of the throne unadulterated. Recall that Naija News reported that the Alaafin had died on Friday evening at the Afe Babalola University Teaching Hospital, Ado-Ekiti during the course of a routine medical check-up and had since been buried. Reacting to the incident, the Ooni spoke on his relationship with the late monarch through a statement by Moses Olafare, his Director of Media and Publicity on Saturday.

item.title: TikToker Claims Instacart Shopper Charged Personal Groceries on Their Account
item.description: An Instacart customer claims a deliverer for the application added tons of items to their order and never got her the groceries to her home. Source: TikTok | @lizkate7While third-party delivery services like DoorDash, GrubHub, Uber Eats, and Instacart have been around for a long time, they really experienced an uptick in users ever since the onset of the COVID-19 pandemic. And like any business, when you've got more customers to deal with, you've got to plan to deal with more customer service issues.

item.title: Ancelotti Points Out Football's Most Persecuted Player In History
item.description: Real Madrid’s coach, Carlo Ancelotti has pointed out that Vinícius Júnior’s unfair treatment on the pitch is harsher than any other player he has coached throughout his career. Ancelotti stood firm in his defence of the Brazilian winger on Saturday, passionately advocating for him amidst the criticism. In Wednesday’s Champions League round-of-16 match against RB Leipzig at the Bernabeu, Vinícius scored Madrid’s only goal in a 1-1 draw but was shown a yellow card for shoving Leipzig captain Willi Orbán.

item.description: Igbo food is known for its rich and diverse soups and stews. Here are the top 3 Igbo soups in Nigeria that are easy to prepare. There are many delicious Igbo soups found in Nigeria. Each soup has a unique flavour profile and ingredients, making Igbo cuisine a diverse and flavorful part of Nigerian culinary heritage.

item.title: Nigeria military releases 1,400 repentant Boko Haram suspects - Borno government
item.description: - Borno state's commissioner for information, Babakura Jato, said about 1, 400 repentant Boko Haram suspects have been released so far by the military - Jato said most of the released persons were mostly relatives of Boko Haram terrorists or persons found to be innocent after investigations - The commissioner dismissed the insinuations that some released Boko Haram repentants have gone back to terrorism About 1,400 repentant Boko Haram suspects have been released and resettled back into the society by the Nigerian military, the Borno state government has confirmed.

item.title: Ortom Reacts To Supeme Court Ruling On Governor Alia Of Benue
item.description: The immediate past Governor of Benue State, Samuel Ortom, has congratulated his successor, Hyacinth Alia, over the Supreme Court confirmation of his victory at the polls. Naija News recalls the Apex Court on Tuesday, affirmed Alia as the duly elected Governor of Benue State following the withdrawal of an appeal by the attorney to Titus Uba of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP). Ortom, in a statement issued on Wednesday by his media aide, Terver Akase, in which he reacted to the development, called on the people of Benue State to join hands with the Governor in moving the state forward.

Weeks after a confusing and largely nonsensical presidential debate between President Joe Biden and Republican nominee Donald Trump, Biden stepped down as the Democratic nominee and paved the way for his VP, Kamala Harris to begin campaigning as the presumptive Democratic nominee.

item.title: Akeredolus Ex-Aide Dumps PDP In Ondo
item.description: Allen Sowore, who previously served as a Special Assistant on new media to the late Governor of Ondo State, Rotimi Akeredolu, and Adviser to the former Deputy Governor, Agboola Ajayi, has officially resigned from the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP). His decision comes in the wake of internal turmoil within the party in the state. Sowore, who also held the position of Director of Media and Publicity in the Ondo South Senatorial District during the 2023 General Election, cited the ongoing crisis in the Ondo State chapter of the PDP as the primary reason for his departure.

item.title: Ekiti Police Commissioner Insists On Sack Of Pregnant Policewoman As IGP Orders Investigation
item.description: The Ekiti State Police Commissioner, Babatunde Mobayo has insisted that the sack of Police Constable, Miss Olajide Omolola, for getting pregnant in service without due authorization followed due process. Mobayo while speaking with journalists in Ado Ekiti on Thursday submitted that Omolola violated section 127 of the police regulation, and her sack is based on the provision of the law. He disclosed that after police school training, a police woman must pass through post-training experience on the field for at least two years before marriage and three years before childbearing.

Maria said the new chapter of her life is called blessed and they can wait to meet the baby.

item.title: Parents Sent Kid to School Knowing He Had Tested Positive for COVID-19
item.description: Parents Sent Kid to School Knowing He Had the CoronavirusBy Robin ZlotnickUpdated Sept. 18 2020, 11:28 a.m. ET Source: iStock PhotoA student at Attleboro High School in Massachusetts attended the first day of in-person school despite having tested positive for the coronavirus just days before. NBC News reports that now, around 30 people who came into contact with the student have been forced to quarantine for two weeks. The mayor of Attleboro, Paul Heroux, says that the student was tested on September 9, got a positive test result on September 11, and then went to school for in-person classes on September 14, despite him and his parents being fully aware that he had COVID-19.

item.description: Former President of Nigeria, Muhammadu Buhari on Wednesday visited business magnate, Alhaji Dahiru Barau Mangal, on a condolence visit over the death of his wife. Naija News recalls the wife of the businessman, Hajiya Aisha Dahiru Mangal died at a hospital in Abuja on Saturday after a protracted illness and her remains had since been buried in Katsina on Sunday. The husband has however continued to receive important dignitaries on condolence visits.

item.title: Jeremiah Perkins - Age, Family, Bio
PDP Has Agreed That North Can Contest For Presidency Despite Getting National Chairman Slot
item.description: The Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) has left its door open for a northern presidential candidate to emerge on its platform for the 2023 elections. This is despite the party zoning its national chairmanship position to the north and shutting out the southern region. As earlier reported by Naija News, former Senate President, Iyorchia Ayu has emerged as the consensus candidate to become the next national chairman of the PDP. This was confirmed on Thursday after hours of continuous meetings by PDP stakeholders of Northern extraction in Abuja.

item.title: Tinubu, APC's Muslim-Muslim Ticket: Suicide For Nigeria's Unity
item.description: Taraba state chapter of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), on Wednesday, said, the Muslim-Muslim ticket decision of the All progressives Congress (APC) and its presidential candidate Bola Tinubu, is a suicide for the unity of Nigeria and her democracy. Mr. Andeta’rang Irammae, the state publicity secretary of the PDP who spoke on behalf of the party with our correspondent in Jalingo, explained that the APC decision was against the Constitution of Nigeria that holds the unity of the citizens democratically wise.

item.title: 'I Never Authorised Mambilla Settlement Agreement With Sunrise'
item.description: Former President, Muhammadu Buhari has categorically stated that he did not approve any settlement agreement with Sunrise Power and Transmission Company Limited over the contentious Mambilla hydroelectric power project. This revelation follows a similar denial by former President, Olusegun Obasanjo, who also refuted claims of authorising a “build, operate and transfer” contract with Sunrise Power in 2003. The dispute over the Mambilla project, intended to construct a 3,050MW plant in Taraba State, escalated when Sunrise Power initiated arbitration against Nigeria at the ICC International Court of Arbitration in Paris, France, on October 10, 2017.

item.title: Brad Stevens - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Basketball coach who led Butler University to two consecutive national championship games, and was named the head coach of the Boston Celtics in 2013. Before Fame He set four school records while playing on the Zionsville Community High School basketball team. Trivia He broke the NCAA record for most wins in a coach's first three years while at Butler. Family Life He married Tracy Wilhelmy Stevens in 2003 and he has a son named Brady and a daughter named Kinsley.

item.title: DSS Secures Court Order To Detain CBNs Emefiele, EFCC's Bawa
item.description: The Department of State Services (DSS) has reportedly obtained an ex parte order from the court to detain the suspended Governor of the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN), Godwin Emefiele, and the suspended Chairman of the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission (EFCC), Abdulrasheed Bawa, beyond 48 hours stipulated in Section 35 of the Constitution. Naija News reports that the embattled Emefiele has spent seven nights in detention and has not been charged to court.

item.title: FG Directs Telcos To Bar Outgoing Calls On Unlinked Lines
item.description: The Muhammadu Buhari-led Federal Government has commended Nigerians for complying with the NIN-SIM linkage, while also directing telecommunications companies to bar outgoing calls on unlinked lines from the 4th of April, 2022. Naija News reports that this was made known in a statement signed by Dr. Ikechukwu Adinde, Director, Public Affairs, NCC and Kayode Adegoke, Head, Corporate Communications, NIMC. The statement disclosed that the Minister of Communication and Digital Economy, Isa Pantami, on behalf of the federal government, gave the directive to telcos.

item.title: The War Between Wives And Their Mother-In-Laws

In Nigeria, you often hear some ladies say they don’t want to get married to a man whose mother is still alive because of the many horrible mother-in-law stories they have heard. However, current celebrations seem to focus more on traditions and practices outside of the religious elements of Easter.

item.title: Natalie Cabo - Age, Family, Bio
Northern APC Youths Protest 11 Governors' Decision To Concede Power To South
item.description: The decision by 11 Northern governors to concede power to the southern part of the country has been criticized by a coalition of northern youth groups of the All Progressives Congress (APC). APC Progressives Youth Elements and the APC North-East Youth Forum protested in Bauchi on Sunday, claiming that the governors were selfish in agreeing to give power to the south. During the protest, the youths were seen holding placards with various inscriptions such as “It’s North or Nothing”, “We are not in support of power shift to South”, “We will not accept the decision of eleven governors”, “It’s in their selfish interest”.

item.title: The First Round of the NFL Draft Is a Movie-Length Event in and of Itself
item.description: The first round of the NFL draft is on Thursday, April 27, but how long will the draft actually take once the ceremony gets started? Source: Getty ImagesAlthough the football season only occupies roughly a third of the calendar year, die-hard NFL fans always find something new to look forward to. Recently, those fans have been looking forward to the NFL draft, which kicks off at 8 p.m. on Thursday, April 27.

item.title: 'Boko Haram Tried To Infiltrate Bandit Terrorists But Failed In 2016'
item.description: A lecturer in the Department of History, Usmanu Danfodiyo University, Sokoto, Dr Murtala Rufa’i has revealed how Boko Haram insurgents tried to infiltrate bandits in the northeast. Speaking in an interview with PUNCH, the university don claimed now-dead terrorist leader, Abubakar Shekau had sent his men to train bandits in 2016. He stated that the Boko Haram members however refused to return to Shekau, choosing to stay back in the northeast.

item.title: Ganduje Kicks Off N2.5bn Road Projects In Kano
item.description: Kano State Government led by Governor Abdullahi Ganduje has commenced road projects in the state worth N2.5bn. The development was made available to newsmen in a statement released on Sunday by the Chief Press Secretary to the Governor, Abba Anwar, Naija News reports. In the statement, Anwar noted that the construction is ongoing in Garo town and neighbouring communities of Kabo Local Government Area of the state. The project according to him will facilitate the movement of citizens and farm produce from rural communities to major markets across the state when completed.

item.title: September 8 Horoscope and Zodiac
item.description: The Virgo's planetary ruler is Mercury, but as you were born in the second Decan, or part, of the sign, Saturn's planetary powers effect you as well. Mercury's influence is reflected in your effective communication and mental abilities, while it is Saturn's powers that are reflected in your control, discipline and assertiveness. The mixture of these two planets makes you the most natural leader of all the Virgo Decans. You will always be driven to perfection and can find yourself quite disappointed when your ideals are not met.

item.title: Federal Govt Finally Recognizes MKO Abiolas Deputy, Babagana Kingibe As Vice President
item.description: The President Muhammadu Buhari-led government on Monday recognised Babagana Kingibe, the running mate of the acclaimed winner of the 1993 presidential election, MKO Abiola, as a former Vice President. Naija News gathered that Kingibe was referred to as former Vice President during the Democracy Day celebration at the Eagles Square. Kingibe was invited to join President Buhari, former President, Goodluck Jonathan and the Senate President, Ahmad Lawan for a group photograph on Monday during the celebration.

In March 2021, it was reported that the founder and CEO of the popular Southern restaurant chain, Texas Roadhouse, died by suicide. Kent Taylor took his own life at the age of 65. item.title: Two Binance Top Officials Arrested, Passports Seized
item.description: Security operatives have reportedly arrested two top officials of cryptocurrency platform, Binance who flew into Nigeria recently. It was gathered, as reported by a UK-based business news outlet, Financial Times, that the officials, whose identities are yet to be made public, were arrested, detained, and their passports seized. The two Binance executives — an American and a British- Pakistani, whose names were not made available, are understood to have been detained on the orders of National Security Adviser (NSA) Nuhu Ribadu over alleged involvement in foreign exchange manipulations.

item.title: National Disgrace - Peter Obi Reacts As Ukraine Donates Grains To Nigeria
item.description: The 2023 presidential candidate of the Labour Party (LP), Peter Obi, has said the donation of grains by Ukraine to Nigeria is disheartening. In a series of posts via his official X handle on Monday, Obi said Nigeria, blessed with vast arable land and abundant natural resources, now relies on a war-torn Ukraine for food assistance. He said the gesture is a national disgrace that stems from years of leadership failure, which needs an urgent reordering of national priorities, resource management, and allocation.

item.title: Police Rescue Bird Woman From Lagos Mob
item.description: There was chaos, Wednesday, in Ajegunle area of Lagos state after a 'bird' transformed into an old woman, with her confessing to being a witch. The old woman who escaped lynching was reported to have confessed to the shocked crowd that she was on her way back to Ibadan, Oyo State from Lagos where they had been sent on a mission (as a bird) with two others when they missed their track, and started hovering in the area until it was morning, adding that she fell because she was tired.

item.title: 'Even The President Knows Things Are Difficult'
item.description: Abia Senator, Orji Uzor Kalu has appealed to the Nigeria Labour Congress (NLC) to shelve its proposed nationwide strike. Kalu made the call in a statement on Sunday via his social media handle in which he said the current difficulty is affecting all Nigerians including both the rich and the poor. According to him, even President Bola Tinubu is aware of the current hardship in the country and any plan by the NLC to proceed with its planned strike action would ridicule the economy.

Dazang while speaking on the incident noted that the ad hoc staff ran for his life during a commotion and in the process could not retrace their ways back.

item.title: Former First Lady Of Enugu Finds Love Again, Sets To Remarry
item.description: Congratulations are in order for the former Enugu state first Lady and Ex wife to former governor Sullivan Chime, Clara, who is reportedly set to marry a new man. Naija News understands that Clara got separated from her husband, the former Enugu governor, nine years ago, before disappearing from the scene. According to SDK source, the former first lady would be tying the knot again traditionally on Friday, April 29,2022.

item.title: Labour Party Faces Uncertainty In A Bid To Replace Lagos Guber Candidate
item.description: The Lagos State chapter of the Labour Party (LP) has been unable to replace its candidate for the 2023 governorship election. The development Naija News understands has thrown the party into uncertainties as the 2023 general elections draw near. The party was supposed to conduct a fresh primary election yesterday, but the process was put on hold following an allegation of tampering with the delegates’ list raised by one of the aspirants, Moshood Salvador.

item.title: Presidency Names Suspended CBN Governor Sanusi Sponsor Of Boko Haram
item.description: Reno Omokri, a pastor and Special Assistant to the President on New Media, has been exposed as the mastermind behind the article that labels the suspended CBN Governor Lamido Sanusi as potential sponsor of the Boko Haram sect. Mr. Omokri, exposed under alias Wendell Simlin, made the accusation in a press release titled 'Increased Tempo of Boko Haram/Terrorist Activity in the Wake of the Sanusi Saga,' which he sent to various media houses.

item.title: TZ pastor arrested for kissing congregants apologises for misleading people, blames it on satan
item.description: Controversial Tanzanian pastor, Tito Machibya, has come out to apologise to his congregants and countrymen claiming he is sorry for misleading them. The pastor claimed he was being led by the devil initially but has now parted ways with him and is now being guided by the Holy Spirit. READ ALSO: Tanzania’s self-styled prophet pictured kissing wife and house girl arrested READ ALSO: Tanzania’s self-styled prophet pictured kissing wife and house girl deemed mentally ill The pastor who made the revelation in an interview with EATV admitted he misled a lot of people including his congregants with unfounded gospel before he was fully saved.

item.description: - Taasisi hiyo ilimfurusha mwanafunzi huyo shuleni Januari 2020 - Mamake alisema shule hiyo ilikikuka haki ya mwanawe kuoata elimu katika shule ambayo aliichagua mwenyewe - Mvulana huyo alikabidhiwa adhabu hiyo baada ya kudaiwa kupigana na wenzake ambapo ni ukiukaji mkubwa wa sheria za shule hiyo Mzozo unanukia kati ya Shule ya Brookhouse na mzazi baada ya taasisi hiyo ya elimu kumfukuza mwanafunzi kwa kupigana na wenzake darasani. Kufuatia hatua hiyo, mamake mwanafunzi huyo aliyefukuzwa mapema 2020 alielekea katika mahakama jijijini Nairobi kumtafutia mwanawe haki.

item.title: Why COVID-19 Cases Are Increasing In Oyo State
item.description: The Oyo State government has explained why there has been a noticeable increase in the number of confirmed coronavirus cases in the state. Naija News recalls Oyo State recorded 103 fresh coronavirus cases (the second-highest) in the latest update given by the Nigeria Center for Disease Control (NCDC) on Thursday evening. Explaining the rising cases, the State Governor, Seyi Makinde noted on Friday that the state has increased its testing capacity after activating ten community-based testing centres.

item.title: Nigeria's Inflation Rises To 20.77 %, NBS Says It Will Remain High Through 2022 Due To Flood
item.description: The National Bureau of Statistics (NBS) has today disclosed in its monthly report that Nigeria’s inflation rate hit 20.77 % in the month of September 2022. According to the report, titled ‘inflation rate rose to 20.77% in September 2022, on a year–on–year basis, the rate increased from 20.52 % in August 2022 to 20.77 % in September 2022, as compared to 16.63 %in September 2021. NBS noted that the inflation rate will continue to remain high this year as a result of the flood in some states, which has destroyed crops and farmlands.

item.title: Denmark | Famous Birthdays
item.description: A Nordic country in Northern Europe. It is the southernmost of the Scandinavian countries. It has 443 islands including Greenland, the largest non-continental island on the planet. Trivia It has the oldest continuously used national flag in the world, comprising a white cross on a red background. It has one of the highest rates of income tax in the world. The Lego company was invented in 1932 in the small town of Billund.

item.title: Full List Of APC Presidential Aspirants Who Stepped Down For Tinubu
item.description: The National Leader and presidential aspirant on the platform of the All Progressives Congress, Bola Tinubu gained the support of seven presidential aspirants who withdrew from the race to support his ambition. The former Minister of Niger Delta, Godswill Akpabio led the move to step down for the former Governor of Lagos State. The lawmaker representing Ogun Central senatorial district, Ibikunle Amosun and Governor of Ekiti state, Kayode Fayemi, also stepped down for Tinubu at the presidential primary of the ruling party.

item.title: Ifeanyi Ubah Defects To APC From YPP
item.description: The Senator representing Anambra South Senatorial District in the National Assembly, Ifeanyi Ubah, has defected to the All Progressives Congress (APC) from the Young Progressives Party (YPP). According to a letter read by Senate President Godswill Akpabio during a brief plenary session on Thursday,  Ubah said his defection was due to irreconcilable differences in the YPP. The letter further explained that Ubah’s decision is in the interest of his constituents.

Ademola Lookman who was the man of the match in Super Eagles’ 2-0 win over Cameroon in the 2023 AFCON round of 16 on Saturday, January 27, noted that the more the Eagles play together the more effective the team would be.

item.title: Outrage As Missing Girl, Ini Ubong Umoren Is Killed , Buried In Uyo
item.description: Nigerians on social media have reacted in anger after missing girl, Iniubong Umoren, the young job seeker, was reportedly murdered and buried in a shallow grave by her abductor. Naija News recalls that the deceased was alleged to have on Thursday, April 29, 2021, went for a “job interview” at an undisclosed location on Airport Road in the outskirts of Uyo. About two hours later, she reportedly made a frantic phone call where she was heard screaming before the call was abruptly ended.

item.title: We Are Ready To Negotiate
item.description: Social media giant, Twitter, has informed the Nigerian government of its readiness to negotiate with the Nigerian government over the suspension placed on its micro-blogging platform. Naija News recalls thatthe Buhari -led government suspended Twitter’s operation indefinitely in Nigeria. This comes after the Minister of Information and Culture, Lai Mohammed, on Friday, in a statement released by his media aide, Segun Adeyemi, announced the suspension of Twitter’s operations in Nigeria indefinitely.

item.title: Virginia Randolph - Trivia, Family, Bio
item.description: Remembered for her tremendous contributions to the field of vocational training, this pioneering African-American educator and America's first "Jeanes [Foundation] Supervising Industrial Teacher" founded the Virginia Randolph Education Center. item.title: UEFA Names Six Clubs To Get Banned From Champions League, Europa League
item.description: The Union of European Football Associations, UEFA has listed six clubs to face a ban over breach of financial fair play regulation. Naija News understands that the football governing body had fined eight clubs including FC Porto and Sporting Lisbon over alleged debts. Insisting on the club’s penalties for non-compliance, UEFA threatened six clubs with exclusion from European competitions. According to the body, the clubs are found guilty of violating UEFA’s Financial Fair Play regulations, due to their “non-compliance with the ‘no overdue payables’ requirement”.

item.description: - Mwanamke mmoja mwenye umri wa miaka 72 anagonga vichwa vya habari akisemekana kuwa mjamzito kwa zaidi ya miaka 30 - Katika video ya kugusa moyo, bibi huyo alisema madaktari walimthibitishia kuwa ana mimba ya miezi sita - Alisema hali hiyo imefanya maisha yake kuwa magumu na kumzuia kufanya kazi kujipatia kipato Habari Nyingine: Mfungwa Atolewa Misumari 30 Tumboni, Kalamu Nne na Sindano Bibi mmoja mwenye umri wa miaka 72, anakumbana na maisha magumu kutokana na hali yake isiyokuwa ya kawaida.

item.title: Fani-Kayode Breaks Silence On Dumping PDP, Reveals Why He Met APC Leaders
item.description: Former Aviation Minister, Femi Fani-Kayode has spoken for the first time since the rumours of his planned defection from the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) to the All Progressives Congress (APC) emerged on Monday. The ex-Minister in a series of tweets on his Twitter account on Tuesday morning denied holding the meetings with APC leaders because of defection plans. While noting that the project of saving Nigeria transcends every political barrier, he added that in the coming days, he would meet with leaders of other political parties in Nigeria.

item.title: IGP Baba Issues Fresh Directives To State Commands
item.description: The management of the Nigeria Police Force (NPF) has moved to stop the agitation by some junior officers. Naija News understands that rank and file in the police force had threatened to embark on a nationwide strike over unfair treatment which includes their salary structure and welfare. The industrial action by the operatives is scheduled to commence on Saturday, March 26 until a positive response is given to their demands.

item.title: We Will Confront You If Your Militia Attacks Southeast
item.description: The Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) has warned former Niger Delta militant leader, Asari Dokubo to keep his Islamic militia from the southeast. The group promised to ensure that the Eastern Security Network (ESN) confronts Dokubo and his militia if they encroach into the Southeast. Speaking via a statement signed by its spokesman, Emma Powerful, the group opined that the Nigerian government is behind the insecurity in the Southeast. They warmed that the ESN should not be blamed for confronting Dokubo’s militia.

item.title: 'Parasite' Star Park So-dam's Representation Just Shared Her Saddening Health Diagnosis With Fans

Source: Getty ImagesIf you've ever seen the award-winning Korean film Parasite, then odds are that you're familiar with Park So-dam. The 30-year-old actress first broke into the mainstream scene in 2015 and has performed in a variety of critically-acclaimed roles ever since. With a love of acting that extends all the way back to her high school years, Park's commitment to her craft has won her awards at the Baeksang Art Awards, the Blue Dragon Film Awards, the Buil Film Awards, and more.

item.description: Famous for her participation in the 2014 Victoria's Secret Fashion Show, this Belgian-Irish model is also known for her advertising campaigns for H&M, Urban Outfitters, Puma, and Ermanno Scervino, as well as for her photo shoots for Glamour, Elle, and Vogue. item.title: 'I Cant Move On, Stay Away From Sheila'
item.description: The logistic manager of Nigerian singer, Davido, Isreal DMW, has warned Nigerian men to stay away from his estranged wife, Sheila Courage. Naija News recalls that Isreal DMW announced in December 2023 that his marriage to Shiela had crashed over irreconcilable differences and accusations. However, in the early hours of Saturday, Isreal in a post shared on his Instagram page, claimed that they are still legally married, hinting that there would be spiritual consequences for messing with Sheila.

item.title: 2023: Sanwo-Olu Doesn't Need Your Worthless Ticket
item.description: The All Progressives Congress (APC) has countered the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) over its offer to make Governor Babajide Sanwo-Olu its candidate in the 2023 governorship election in Lagos. The APC which described the PDP offer as a worthless Greek gift said it is rather unfortunate that the opposition party can’t find any qualified person within its fold to present as its gubernatorial candidate and now has to try poaching Sanwo-Olu.

item.title: Buhari Jets Out To London For Medical Checkup
item.description: President Muhammadu Buhari has embarked on a medical trip to London, United Kingdom. The Nigerian leader departed Abuja on Sunday, Naija News reports. Buhari’s spokesman, Femi Adesina had announced last month that the Nigerian leader would visit his doctor in London for “routine medical checks that will last for a maximum of two weeks”. Another announcement, however, followed shortly that President Buhari has cut short his planned trip and returned to Abuja after the United Nations event in Kenya.

In the video, his alleged admirer constantly showered him with gifts and meals as a pledge of his affection. The video had generated outrage from Nigerians who called for his arrest as homosexuality is illegal in the country.

item.title: Gani Adams Warns Against Sit-At-Home Protest In Lagos
item.description: Aare Ona Kakanfo of Yorubaland, Gani Adams has warned the factional leader of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB), Simon Ekpa against carrying out a sit-at-home protest in Lagos. The protest, aimed at pressing the Federal Government for the release of IPOB leader, Nnamdi Kanu, is currently happening in South East Nigeria. Adams stated that IPOB should not attempt to impose its agenda on Lagos or other parts of the South West, as the region is not part of the Biafra Republic.

item.title: FG Reveals Why Workers Have Not Received June Salary
item.description: The Federal Government on Wednesday attributed the delay in June salary payments for some government employees to technical challenges. The Director of Press at the Office of the Accountant-General of the Federation (OAGF), Bawa Mokwa relayed this information on Wednesday. Mokwa specified that the issues originated from the Government Integrated Financial Management System (GIFMIS), a salary payment platform. The OAGF is working tirelessly to resolve the problem. He said, “As we speak, the directors and the consultant in charge of the platforms are in a crucial meeting, working round the clock to resolve the problem.

item.title: Thomas Edison - Trivia, Family, Bio
item.description: He invented early versions of the light bulb, the phonograph, and the motion picture camera, and became a legend for contributions to telecommunications and industry. With 1,093 U.S. patents in his name, he is considered the fourth most prolific inventor in history. Before Fame He sold candy, newspapers, and vegetables to train passengers who were going from Port Huron to Detroit. Trivia His favorite movie was The Birth of a Nation and he felt that the invention of sound in film had ruined the medium.

item.title: Andrew Dawson's TikTok Leaves Behind a Trail of Creepy Conspiracy Theories
item.description: Home > Viral News > Influencers > TikTokAndrew Dawson's Tiktok has conspiracy theorists spiraling about his footage. The influencer supposedly captured footage of strange phenomena. Conspiracy theory culture can really run the gamut. It can start off as simple as asking some of the harder existential questions, like, "Are we alone in the universe?" or "Does the supernatural exist?" but it can be easy for people to fall into rabbit holes and start to question everything in our society to an obsessive degree.

item.title: Makinde Joins June 12 Protesters In Ibadan [Video]
item.description: Governor Seyi Makinde of Oyo state joined other protesters in Ibadan, the state capital to mark the June 12 Democracy Day. Clad in a brown attire, gvernior Makinde emerged amidst cheers and loud praises. The protesters are protesting against bad governance, insecurity, and against the Muhammadu Buhari adminsitration. Meanwhile, popular Nigerian comedian, Debo Adebayo, also known as Mr Macaroni, has joined protesters at the Gani Fawehinmi Park in the Ojota area, the venue of the June 12 protest in Lagos State.

item.description: - Ugandan opposition leader Kizza Besigye was arrested after he illegally swore himself in as the country's president - This was despite the fact that he lost the election to incumbent president elect Yoweri Museveni Tension has been for the better part of today high in Kampala, Uganda ahead of the swearing in of president elect Yoweri Museveni tomorrow on Thursday, May 12. item.title: Mike Sonko amwonyesha Kidero kitu kwenye simu yake, ni nini? (picha)
item.description: - Gavana wa kaunti ya Nairobi Evans Kidero na Seneta Mike Sonko walionekana pamoja, kinyume na matarajio ya wengi siku ya Jumapili, Juni 11 - Wakenya walionekana kutaka kufahamu kuhusu jambo fulani waliolifanya wakati huo wakiwa pamoja Habari Nyingine: Uhuru azuru NGOME ya Raila na kuwaacha wenyeji na MACHOZI. Je, sababu ni nini? Picha moja ya Gavana Kidero na Mike Sonko wakiwa wanajadiliana kuhusu kitu fulani kwenye simu inazidi kuzua mjadala mitandaoni.

item.title: Pantami Reacts To ASUUs Stand Against His Professorship
item.description: The Minister of Communication and Digital Economy, Isa Ali Pantami, has decided not to speak on the stand of the Academic Staff Union of Universities (ASUU) against his professorship. Recall that Pantami alongside seven academics in September 2021 was promoted by the Federal University of Technology, Owerri (FUTO) to the position of a professorship at the council’s 186th meeting. On Monday, ASUU described the minister’s promotion as a professor of Cybersecurity by the Federal University of Technology, Owerri as illegal.

item.title: 'Deceive Inc.' Review: A Quirky Spy Extraction Shooter With Massive Potential
item.description: Here's our review of 'Deceive Inc.,' a multiplayer extraction shooter blending spy subterfuge. It's a quirky and fun combo in practice, here's our thoughts. Source: Sweet Bandits StudiosFrom left to right: Chavez, Larcin, Yu-Mi, Hans, Ace, Madame Xiu, Squire, and Cavalière. At the heels of an unsuspecting rival spy, gunfire reverberates in the distance. The package we were all vying to steal under the noses of tight security is now gone, sparking reckless scuffles over the underwater hotel.

item.title: Court Restores Soludo As Anambra APGA Guber Candidate
item.description: A Federal High Court sitting in Awka has reinstated a former governor of the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN), Charles Soludo, as the candidate of the All Progressives Grand Alliance (APGA). Recall that the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) had in a list released on July 16 picked Michael Umeoji over Soludo as the standard-bearer for APGA. According to the electoral umpire, the decision was based on court orders. Festus Okoye, INEC’s commissioner for Information and Voter education, revealed that Musa Ubale, judge of a high court in Jigawa State, had passed judgment in suit JDU/022/21, upholding the suspension of Victor Oye (Chairman of a faction of APGA) and affirming Jude Okeke as the party’s national chairman on June 30, 2021.

item.title: Robert Pattinson Bulked up for The Batman Despite His Past Comments
item.description: Recent paparazzi photos of the Twilight star Robert Pattinson have surfaced and he seems to be working on his physique to the delight of Batman fans. Source: Getty ImagesRobert Pattinson was announced as the new Bruce Wayne in what seems like ages ago, and since then, he has had to take a lot of critique and criticism from fans who believe he may not be the best pick for the role.

item.title: Which country is the richest in Africa?
item.description: Hearing about Africa, many people think about the numerous peoples and tribes most of which live in extreme poverty. Nevertheless, there are many countries on the continent that enjoy prosperity and have thriving economy. This is not surprising because Africa provides many opportunities for high economic indicators. This is greatly facilitated by a favorable climate, abundant natural resources, and raw materials. From this article, you will find out which country is the richest in Africa.

item.title: Will There Be a 'Magnum P.I.' Season 5? Don't Get Your Hopes up
item.description: The 'Magnum P.I.' reboot has been around since 2018, but will the show get a Season 5? After the Season 4 finale, fans are worried that the show is done. Source: CBSSpoiler alert: This article contains spoilers for the Season 4 finale of Magnum P.I. When fans of the original Magnum P.I. heard the show would be rebooted for a new audience, many were skeptical. However, they quickly grew to love the new version of Magnum, played by Jay Hernandez.

item.title: APGA Chieftain, Victor Umeh Turned Back In Ihiala [Photos]
item.description: A chieftain of the All Progressives Grand Alliance (APGA), Victor Umeh was denied access on Tuesday morning by security forces in Ihiala local government headquarters. Umeh who is said to have arrived at the LGA headquarters with other party members was confronted by the GOC, 82 Division for showing up where they shouldn’t be. “You are not supposed to be here,” the GOC reportedly screamed at Umeh who insisted that he was there “to ensure things go well”.

item.title: Only FG can declare IPOB leader Nnamdi Kanu wanted - Buratai
item.description: - Lieutenant General Tukur Buratai says IPOB leader Nnamdi Kanu can be declared wanted by the federal government - The chief of army staff claims only the federal government has the constitutional right to do so - He added that the army was not under any pressure to withdraw troops from the southeast Nigeria's Chief of Army staff, Lieutenant General Tukur Buratai, has said that the leader of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) Nnamdi Kanu can be declared wanted by the federal government.
